Cohort: Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents & Children (ALSPAC)
Low mood: Appears miserable or tearful
Interpersonal aggression: Fights with other children / bullies other children / bites or kicks other children
Anger/irritability: Is irritable
Disruptive/disobedient: Is disobedient / is inconsiderate of others
Worry: Worries about many things
Lies: Tells lies / blames others for things
Prosocial: Tries to be fair in games / Is affectionate to family members / Helps around house voluntary / Will help someone who is hurt / Is kind to young children / Helps children feeling ill / Comforts child who is upset / Is kind to animals / Tries to stop quarrels / Is considerate for others / Doesnt share toys / Shares treats with friends
General anxiety/fear: Is afraid of new things
Twitches /habit: Twitches or Has Tics / Bites Nails or Fingers
Hyperactivity/arousal/restlessness: Is restless and doesn't keep still / Is squirmy and fidgety
Attention span: Has short attention span / is inattentive
Social skills – (popular, lots of friend: Other children dislike child / does things on own / gets on with other children
Competitive: Is independent, confident / is forceful and determined
Soiling: Has wet self in the past 12 months
Speech difficulty: Has stutter or stammer / has speech difficulty

Cohort: Millenium Cohort Study (MCS)
Low mood: 13. Is often unhappy, down hearted or tearful
Interpersonal aggression: 12. Often fights with other children or bullies them / 22. Can be spiteful to others

Disruptive/disobedient: 7. Is generally obedient, usually does what adults request / 18. Often argumentative with adults

Steals: 22. Steals from home, school or elsewhere

Social skills – (popular, lots of friend: 11. Has at least one good friends / 14. Is generally liked by other children / 19. Is picked on or bullied by other children
Social preference (loner etc. ): 6. Is rather solitary, tends to play alone / 23. Gets on better with adults than with other children

Cohort: National Survey of Health and Development (NSHD)
Low mood: 20.Do you keep reasonably cheerful or have you been very depressed or low spirited recently? Have you cried at all? (Rate depressed mood)
Fatigue: 3.Have you been exhausted and worn out during the day or evening even when you haven’t been working very hard? (rate tiredness/exhaustion) / 31.Do you seem to be slowed down in your movements, or have too little energy recently? How much has this affected you? (rate subjective anergia and retardation)
Tense/stressed: 7.Do you often feel on edge, or keyed up, or mentally tense or strained? (rate nervous tension) / 4.Have you had difficulty relaxing in the past month/muscles feel tensed up? (rate muscular tension)
Sleep problems: 30.Have you had any trouble getting off to sleep in the last month? (rate delayed sleep) / 32.[IF SLEEP DISTURBANCES OR DEPRESSION] Do you wake early in the morning? (rate early waking)
Worry: 1.What is it like when you worry? A round of painful thought which cannot be stopped and is out of proportion to the subject worried about (rate worrying)
General anxiety: 8.Have there been times when you have been very anxious or frightened? (rate autonomic anxiety ) / 9.Have you had the feeling that something terrible might happen? (rate anxious foreboding)
Irritability: 35.Have you been very much more irritable than usual recently? (rate irritability)
Panic: 11.Have you had times when you felt shaky or you heart pounded or you felt sweaty and you simply had to do something about it? (rate panic attacks)
Hopelessness: 21.How do you see the future? (rate hopelessness)
Loss of interest: 19.What about your interests, have they changed at all? Have you lost interest in work, hobbies recreations/ let your appearance go? (rate loss of interest)
Appetite disturbance: 29.What has your appetite been like recently? (rate weight loss)
Health anxiety/perceived poor health: 6.Do you tend to worry over your physical health? (rate hypochondriasis)
Restlessness: 5.Have you been so fidgety and restless that you couldn’t sit still? (rate restlessness)
Social phobia: 13.What about meeting people e.g. going into a crowded room, making conversation? (rate anxiety of meeting people)
Cognitive impairment - concentration pr: 17.What has your concentration been like recently? (rate poor concentration)
Cognitive impairment - indecision: 41.Do you find it difficult to make decisions about trivial things? (rate obsessional ideas and rumination)
Somatic complaints: 2.Have you had headaches or other aches and pains during the past month (rate tension pains)?
Worthlessness/self-esteem: 24.What is your opinion of yourself compared to other people? (rate self-depreciation) / 25.How confident do you feel in yourself? (rate lack of self-confidence) / 26.Are you self-conscious in public? (rate simple ideas of reference)
Suicidal ideation: 22.Have you felt that life wasn’t worth living? (rate suicidal acts or plans)
Situational anxiety: 12.Do you tend to get anxious in certain situations such as being alone or being in a lift or tube train? (rate situational anxiety) / 23.Have you wanted to stay away from people? (rate social withdrawal) / 14.Do you have any special fears, like some people are scared of feathers, or cats, or spiders, or birds? (rate phobias)
